This, like most canons, apparently, will do 1fps for up to 2 hours (20 minutes will net 40 seconds of capture - use tripod or set on stable place and work on your crossword puzzles).The regular VGA quality video is great with good mono sound. And I've been pleased with the quality of the photos shot at the 'fine' quality setting. Handles shadows and tonal values well.This SD1100IS is a pocket rocket for features - the manual (all in English) is over 200 pages. You NEED to read it to get the most out of it, but of course you can just start on Auto and do OK.Size was a major consideration and this beauty sits in a belt case I had and takes very little space. I use with an 8GB SD card now, so the sky's the limit!I recommend you give this serious consideration if you have some of the same requirements I did.

Reviews.Title: great little camera for the road
Reviews.Author: Christoph Geiss "ceg"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very small and fits comfortably in ones hand. Small changes in the camera's body make it feel smaller than one of its earlier predecessors, the Powershot SD 600 even though the actual dimensions are pretty much the same.There is much to love about this camera, but the most important points are: its small size, robust metal body, decent picture quality and surprising array of functions, which let you shoot under a wide range of conditions and override (or fool) many of the automatic settings. To make the most of this camera you need to read the manual carefully because many cool features are deeply hidden.My only complaint is the use of a special rechargeable battery. I like to take my camera on extended trips and after a about 250 pictures I have to hunt for an AC outlet (with my other camera, a Powershot A710 IS, I just pop in two new AA's). That's when the (pretty cheap) optical viewfinder comes in handy.The image stabilizer is nice - the usefulness of the face detection algorithm is debatable, but its presence sure doesn't hurt.In summary, its a great point and shoot camera. I have it in my jacket pocket almost every day.

Reviews.Title: PhotoStitch
Reviews.Author: MyAwesomePenName
Reviews.Content: As everyone else has said, this camera is great; small, cute, works perfectly.What I want to add is that the software that comes with it is amazing. The camera has a function to help you line up panorama shots, and the CD that comes with the camera has a program called PhotoStitch that will stitch the peices together into a panoramic picture. It works great! The program senses by itself where the pictures should line up and puts them together; for far away views you can't even tell where the pictures were stitched together. Its amazing.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Sara E. Anderson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after losing my last one, which was just terrible. Grass is always greener, I suppose.  I really love this one, with the image stabilization, and its size being so convenient for keeping in my pocket.  I also love that it has a lens through which you can see what you're taking a picture of, if it's too bright for the LCD.

Reviews.Title: Everything you need in one little pocket
Reviews.Author: M. Carson "Live to Ride"
Reviews.Content: Very portable for vacations, used mostly when on motorcycle.  This camera has all options and features that my professional grade SLR has; the only gripe is the zoom.  If you want perfect clarity, don't count on the zoom too much.  Impressive macro ability.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera.  Quality for a decent price.
Reviews.Author: Rosaidh Ceallach
Reviews.Content: I had the SD1000 (also a very nice camera)and decided to give that camera to a relative. I bought the SD1100 and it is a high quality compact camera for a relatively low price. I like the size because I can take it almost anywhere. My daughter will be taking trip to Ireland and I bought her one as well. I have a NIKON 1200 (high end camera) but truly only pull that out for weddings or when I am taking photographs of the kids for school. This little camera was all I used for my daughters birthday party and the pictures turned out great. You can't go wrong if you want nice pictures and don't want to pay a lot of money for a high end camera (which tends to be more complicated to use if you really want to get a bang for your buck.)

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: S. M. Chapman
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  My husband lost our Canon PowerShot that we bought in 2006--yes, I nearly killed him--so we had no other choice but to buy a new model.  The 2008 model is by far superior to our 2006 camera and cost about $150 less!  Technology is improving so quickly!  But I love the size of this camera, the quality of the pictues are excellent, and I love the options and features.  Everyone should own this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Witek
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my husband's birthday and now he carries it everywhere with him, raving how great it is cause its so small. Most importantly this camera takes wonderfull photos with great colors that are very clear and sharp. We bought a 4gig memory stick for it and there is room for plenty of photos with a crisp and clear resolution. One thing is for sure, no matter how much your hands shake you will still be able to take great shots with this camera with the image stabilizer turned on.Overall this is a great camera to have especially if you are traveling and do not want to carry a bulky camera, especially with kids in tow.

Reviews.Title: Excellent take anywhere camera
Reviews.Author: C. Tucker "cytaz"
Reviews.Content: A lot has already been written about this camera. It has met my expectations for a pocket snapshot and video camera...clear pictures and video while always being just the right size to fit into my small purse or my pocket. There are better cameras that are larger, but they would get left at home due to their inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: great little camera!
Reviews.Author: slakn "slaknelson"
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use. The battery last a long time and recharges quickly.  The pictures are REALLY good!  I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Pocket perfect
Reviews.Author: John Vitange "MISTRV"
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the features a point and shoot needs.  And you can carry it anywhere. Make sure and buy a 1 gig or higher memory card.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera/camcorder
Reviews.Author: kanyarwanda
Reviews.Content: After much research, I settled on this little camera for three reasons: (1) It produces surprisingly good videos, (2) It has an optical viewfinder which makes it easy to operate in very bright sunlight and allows one to hold the camera close to the body--and hence less camera-shake, (3) It is small enough to fit into one's shirt pocket. All of the above were my criteria for a camcorder to use unobstrusively in a country where tourists are the target of gangsters and crooks, and where a regular camcorder would be very tempting. A bonus: excellent photos for a point-and-shoot!

Reviews.Title: INCREDIBLE CAMERA!!!!
Reviews.Author: Andrea Photog Gal "Photog Gal"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this camera!!! It's so tiny, so easy to use, and the pictures are absolutely gorgeous. The camera itself is beautiful, too.The zoom function is great and so is the image stabilizer. There are all sorts of great effects, including fun ways you can play around with color, enhancing certain colors, or shooting in black and white or sepia. You can also make sound recordings and video recordings. I've had a few cameras and this is the best one by far, even better than a much fancier expensive one  I bought earlier this year.I have only one complaint, which is that the User's Guide is disorganized and hard to understand, with pages referring the reader to other pages so many times that it's dizzying. However, the camera is so easy to use, so intuitive, that this should not hold anyone back from getting this fantastic camera.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!  -Not so much anymore
Reviews.Author: Ariel
Reviews.Content: I have to edit my review because I am having problems with this camera.  I will save my positive comments below, though.I love this camera so much.  I have recommended it to everyone I know.  Well, now I am regretting that because I have only had the camera since July (4 months), and I am getting Lens Error messages.When you get a lens error, the camera beeps and the lens will not come out.  Canon's website does not have any solution for this on their website, but I found a lot of people had the same problem when I searched the internet today.I am supremely disappointed because this camera is so great in every other way.  I am now telling everybody I know not to buy this camera because I don't want them to experience the same problem as I am currently having.-----------------------------------------------------I have a Canon PowerShot SD550 camera that I used for a few years, and I was ready for something new.I love Canon cameras.  The buttons are very user friendly.  This camera was rated highly on Consumer Reports.  You can take pictures quickly with this camera, which is a big plus for me.I also love some of the things you can do in the color settings.  You can choose one color as an accent color, and it turns everything else black and white.The flash works really well...you can take a picture in a dark area, and still get a great picture with the flash.  And it's not one of those flashes that blinks 500 times before taking the picture!Plus, you get to pick between several colors!!  This is a great camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot DS1100IS
Reviews.Author: V  Nguyen
Reviews.Content: This camera is one of the best price-performance ratio in the Canon Powershot line. It has more-than-sufficient 8 mega pixels and the image stablilizer and face recognition features and has a decent speed when capturing pictures. Even though you buy the camera based on the features and the price, the color of the body (mine is pink and the wife likes it since no one will want to borrow her camera again) makes it very unique and cute and makes it different among the common metallic gray color of the millions of cameras.  On the improvement side, it will be better if this camera has a larger screen size even if sacrificing the viewfinder then it is still more desirable.  The SD1100IS is highly recommmended.

Reviews.Title: So easy to use
Reviews.Author: Dawn M. Santora "Maddie Boo"
Reviews.Content: I love my little Canon. It took minutes to start taking beutiful pictures. I would recommend it to everyone. The price was a huge savings from the stores.

Reviews.Title: bad delivery, nice camera
Reviews.Author: Dean Morris
Reviews.Content: My delivery from Amazon was fast at the best price anywhere, but the battery and memory card packages were flopping around in the box because it was inadequately packed and the corner was crushed -- luckily the camera seems to be ok.Let me jump ahead of myself to alert you: ***if the screen goes black when you turn the camera vertically, put your hand up to your ear and remove your polarized sunglasses!!!***The (reddish) brown is butt-ugly but reduces glare from around the viewfinder. The plastic doors are unimpressive, I hope they hold up. The buttons are simply arranged and well thought-out among monitor displays, menus, and functions. I wish the lens started out with a wider angle. The body size is nice and small, smaller than I expected from the product photo. Startup, shutter reponse, and recovery are still too slow. Movies are easy to shoot.Special-feature-wise you can easily set up color accent, color swap, sepia, dark or light skin tones and get obvious results. Other custom color settings changes are barely noticable. Stitching pictures that overlap in any way can be done in their verrrrry slooooow software. I often need to take two shots with different readings because the meter can't manage sky detail and shade detail in a single shot.

Reviews.Title: FINALLY!
Reviews.Author: Claudia J. Ochoa
Reviews.Content: i have always been a canon user until i got these rave reviews about the samsung NV10 so i bought it. i did not like that i could not just point and shoot a good pic. i had always had to play with it for a while (i know this is not a review for NV10) but with that being said once i decided to back to canon and see what the SD1100 was about...i had NO regrets! this camera takes AMAZING pics! with very little navigation too! the macro option is really cool too!it did have an screen error message after a week and half of using it but that is the AMAZING thing about AMAZON, returned it and they sent me a new one...just like that!if i could give more stars i would! i am inspired to take pictures again!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Point-n-Shoot Camera!
Reviews.Author: Yousef and Dima
Reviews.Content: As they say, good things come in small packages! This is a performant, yet easy-to-use point and shoot camera. Takes sharp clear images on the fly, and has a couple of cool features like face detection technology, motion detection technology, and much more. I recommend it for hobbiests; Canon Rocks in the field of digital imaging!

Reviews.Title: Cannon SD1100IS
Reviews.Author: DMF
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the quality of the photos and the camera itself. Just what I was looking for...a compact point and shoot with the features I needed. I did purchase an additional battery but have not yet needed it during normal photos sessions. I also purchased a 2 GB memory card which allows many photos and video before it fills. Bottom line... great 8 MP camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for family use!!
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Frederick
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a replacement camera for my wife, and so far, both of us would agree that it was well worth it.  The camera is very easy to operate, produces stunning pictures for such a small camera, and is just plain fun to use.  It has several modes to work with, but we mainly stick with just shooting images.  We currently use a 1 gig card to store the pictures, and so far that has been more than adequate.  For those that shoot a lot of photos before emptying the card may want to get a bigger one though.  For casual home use though, the 1 gig has been more than adequate.  The only nitpick I have regarding the memory card is that putting it back in takes a little extra effort for someone like myself who has big fingers.  It's a very minor thing and should not be a discriminating factor as the camera overall is superb.  Canon tends to produce some very nice small cameras, and this one is no exception.  So far my wife really likes it and has been using it quite a bit to shoot general images she probably would have passed on with her previous camera.  Like all gadgets, read the directions first as that will make it easier using it.  Overall, we're both very impressed with it and would highly recommend it to anyone needing a small and dependable camera that takes outstanding images.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD 1100IS Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Cathy Turner "cat"
Reviews.Content: My 19 year old daughter bought the camera and loved it!I needed a camera to carry around in my purse so I bought this camera, it takes wonderful pictures. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Alva C. Von Heimburg
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot camera.  I've used it for a week now.  I've taken pictures of at an air show with the Thunderbirds, and lots of pictures of my 1-year grandson (which is definitely a challenge). It has been great.  I wish the zoom was a bit more, but it's OK.  It took some time learning the basics and there's still a lot more I need to learn to utilize all of the features.

Reviews.Title: The best camera!
Reviews.Author: C. J. Burgess
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. I have one for home, and it is perfect for shots of family & friends. All of the functions are easy to use. Then I bought one for work and that's been great too. It is a simple, versatile camera for the  average person.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: L. Sensenbrenner "CT Books"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! Great pictures each and every time. Nice and light- easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Canon's little powerhouse
Reviews.Author: Janet Spain "Jan Spain"
Reviews.Content: This SD1100 might be Canon's best little digital Elph yet. The image quality is superb and the handling great. So there are not manual controls...save them for the SLRs out there. This camera does what it promises...takes great photos with little to no experience needed in the user. The image stabilization, LCD, picture modes, and the fact that it does have a viewfinder make this little camera a virtual powerhouse. The size is perfect for back pockets and the color choices are icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: I can't believe what t his "little" camera can do
Reviews.Author: Martin Price "Ag man"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a pocket-sized camera that could be a constant companion and instantly available, compared to my Canon G3 which has to hang around my neck or be carried in a bag.  I spent hours comparing cameras and reviewing user comments, then bought the SD 1100IS and headed off for a two week vacation in Alaska.I am amazed what this little camera can do, often more easily than the G3. At the midnight baseball game without lights in Fairbanks on the longest day of the year I took hand-held telephoto shots filling the screen with the scoreboard, complicated field lighting, and then hand-held closeups of the face of my watch with sharp focus. It is my first experience with stabilizing feature and now would not want to do without it.

Reviews.Title: Great little point-and-click!
Reviews.Author: Jodi Parsons "merbrat"
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I am the worse photographer. I am terrible with a camera. However, I needed something during my travels in Europe and, after careful review of the other point-and-click cameras, decided to go with this one. I am very happy with it! There are lots of cool features about this camera, like the video recording and digital image switch to micro photos (for flora shots). The color of the images are close to accurate and the camera does help in stabilizing pictures that are awkward to take, like the ceilings of a cathedral. It's very light weight and compact, which were two features that were important to me. All in all, a good little camera. I would recommend this item to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Perfect fun useful camera!
Reviews.Author: Ale GG
Reviews.Content: It has cool features like face recognition and color selection!! Love it! Gold is very unique and not very bling blig, more of a sandy color.

Reviews.Title: Nice and Simple
Reviews.Author: J. Brown
Reviews.Content: This is a simple little camera and is quick in every way.  I have had a few canon cameras in the past and not too much has changed.  You get solid photos from this point and shoot.  Not as good as a digital SLR but then again the cost and size make those every day trips great.  If you are looking for a nice little camera, that takes very good photos, quick to start up and easy to use, this is the one for you.Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Quick, easy, great pictures
Reviews.Author: Alexander Verbeck
Reviews.Content: I decided to get the SD 1100, rather than the 1000 or 750 my friends have, and I'm glad I did. The image stabilization works well, and having the extra megapixels means my shots consistently look just a bit better than theirs. Further, the thing is so remarkably small that it comes with me almost everywhere. It boots up quickly, too, making it easier to get shots of animals or moving people.I didn't install the included software, so I can't comment on that, but I do appreciate that pictures import into Picasa just fine without it.

Reviews.Title: Super camera
Reviews.Author: C. Morrissey "Campbell"
Reviews.Content: I really LOVE this camera.  I have a very expensive Canon (pro type) since my hobby is scrap booking, and I needed a small camera for the purse.  The quality is really outstanding and the cost fair.  I was shocked when I developed my first photos and I was even more shocked when my son showed me all the things I can do with my new camera.  It's very fun to use and easy too!  I get so many compliments on the pink color.  Every time I let someone borrow it, they go and buy one for themselves.  That's how great it is.  I just bought another one for my son who will attend Berkeley in the fall.  He loves his too!

Reviews.Title: Nice and tinny
Reviews.Author: Claudia P. Sanchez Hernandez "Claudia Sanchez"
Reviews.Content: It's a very good camera, nice and small. Easy to use, and take beatifull pictures. I had before a Lumix Panasonic and a HP, and this one is superior in everything and almost the same price. Very recommendable.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Higginbotham "Travelinmom"
Reviews.Content: This camera fits in my purse and I use it everywhere. The pictures are of good quality and the zoom is very good for such a small camera. Perfect camera for on the go and spur of the moment.

Reviews.Title: Cute little camera
Reviews.Author: L. Whelan "clumsy chick"
Reviews.Content: [ASIN:B0011ZK6PC Canon PowerShot SD1100IS 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Blue)]]Small enough for my purse!  Easy to use.  Fun and accessible.  Manual was a cinch for the most part, even hooking up to the printer.  Beautiful pictures!! I wish the memory card was a bit bigger.  Also, a small case wouldn't have hurt.  Otherwise, almost perfect!

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Bike Riding Mommy
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  I shopped around and read reviews and decided to buy this camera instead of other cheaper versions.  The price wasn't too bad and the quality of picture is very nice.  I love the red eye reduction feature!  Overall, the camera is great and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: A Lot of camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera. It take nice clear pictures, battery life is pretty good, and its very compact. Definitely a good product.

Reviews.Title: Great  camera
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD1100IS 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Pink) Purchased this camera for my wife. It is her first digital camera. I set it on automatic and she takes great pictures. It is small enough to be carried in her purse with an extra battery. I put in a 2GB SD card so there is plenty of storage. Always having in with her has encouraged her to regularly use it.When I don't take my larger camera, it becomes our primary camera. It has enough manual setting to fit most situations and the IS is a great feature.I definitely recommend this camera for anyone who is looking for a smallcamera that is easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: by far the best!
Reviews.Author: ideaman "promopro"
Reviews.Content: I use a $5,000+ Canon professional camera every day and the shots from the PowerShot are just as vibrent! It is so much fun to use. Whatever you buy, make sure you have a viewfinder.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, amazing size
Reviews.Author: Caryn
Reviews.Content: We had been looking for a new camera to replace our 3mp nikon and were ready to get the 870 when the 1100 came out.  Needless to say we are very happy that we went with 1100.  It has done a great job taking clear, non blurry images, has a nice amount of settings to help with more creative shots.  The size is simply perfect, incredibly small but just the right size to allow for comfortable picture taking.  I especially like the small indent on the left face that fits your finger perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Andrea McCormick "MrsPepper244"
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera for my birthday, and let me tell you, I'm so happy with it.  the clarity with the pictures are great.  It's small enough to fit in my purse without any problems.  I love all the features, how I can change colors around.  I can't wait to take a trip and really test it out.  It is so worth the money you will pay for this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Fuzzy pictures in anything other than ideal light
Reviews.Author: P. P. Maholchic
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera based upon the reviews fromsome of the more notable review sites and was somewhatdisappointed in the image quality both indoors andunder less than full bright sunlight.  It would bea great camera for a kid to play with but not especiallyfor a photographer.  All images appear fuzzy and softto me under any situation other than ideal light. Thestart up time and focusing time is a bit better thanthe competition but that's the only advantage that I cansee in this toy camera. I have a 2 megapixel old Olympuscamera that takes sharper and better exposed indoor shots.I guess the trade off is that if you want something thatyou can fit in your shirt pocket or a toy for a kid thanthis would be a good choice.  This is not a camera forthose of us who like sharp well focused image quality.And what is it with the white balance?  AWFUL indeed!All indoor shots have this yellow cast that I findobjectionable.  Save your money and look at some offeringsfrom Olympus or one of the other manufacturers.I sold mine on ebay and bought a Finepix f50fd for about thesame price.  The difference in image quality is like night andday.

Reviews.Title: Lens won't retract
Reviews.Author: D. Decker
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas 2008.  It's a nice camera and she likes it, but suddenly after two months the lens is stuck open.  She claims she didn't harm the camera in any way, but it just wouldn't close one day.  Now when we try to turn the camera on, it makes a clicking noise for a while and then displays the error, "lens error, restart camera."  The camera is completely useless now and will not operate.  I'm going to call Canon for service, but many of the posts I have read state that this is not covered by warranty.

Reviews.Title: broke in less than a year
Reviews.Author: Elliot R. Leboeuf
Reviews.Content: i bought mine in july, $150, and i have no idea why it costs 300 dollars now. That's ridiculous. especially because mine broke, and completely would not turn on, after 9 months of use. The repair people wanted $100 dollars just to take it apart and diagnose it. Needless to say I bought a new one.

Reviews.Title: great pictures but after a while, i got the dreaded "Lens error, restart" problem.
Reviews.Author: bronzefury
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it was highly rated.  It took great pictures and I took very good care of it.  But, after some time, I started getting the "Lens error, restart camera" issue.  This is a major problem.  Just search on the internet about it and you will see many complaints.  I had to take it to Canon service in Irvine, CA and waited almost two hours in line before a customer service rep helped me.  There were many people in line for various camera issues for Powershots and Digital SLRs.  I wouldn't recommend Canon.The lesson that I learned was, when researching a product before buying, search for the problems of the product in addition to looking at user ratings.

Reviews.Title: Len error renders camera useless
Reviews.Author: nilcritz
Reviews.Content: I got a lens error after using the camera only for about 3 months. It is well documented across this forum.I used a Sony Cybershot 5 MP for 5 years from 2004 till now and it was flawless and gave excellent picture quality.I thought of an upgrade and decided to buy this camera as it has the best reviews. However, the picture quality is lemon compared to my old Sony. It is not what I thought it would be. Overall waste of time and some wasted picture and video clip opportunities as I am stuck with a down camera. I am initiating a complaint to Canon now - hopefully I get the model replaced.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't ask for more
Reviews.Author: B. Litman
Reviews.Content: I just back from a backpacking trip through europe and this camera became my best friend. I was especially used to my Panasonic Lumix and was afraid it was going to take me some time getting used to the naviagation of a new digital camera. However, in the first 2 days I was able to switch back and forth between different modes and settings, snapping crystal clear shots and videos with ease. The images look fantastic after uploading them and I can't wait to enlarge some of them.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: jim "fusionwoodworks"
Reviews.Content: Fast!  I was so tired of how slow to focus and shoot small digital point and shoot cameras are after you press the shutter.  This one is fast.  Picture quality is great, video quality high, too. Also an option to take 640x480 pics to send for email! Yay.  We'll see about the lens sticking problem.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Worden "Confuzzlebug"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for a simple little digital. There's not much of a delay when you hit the shutter button and the image quality is awesome. I would definitely recommend this to a friend!

Reviews.Title: VERY HAPPY
Reviews.Author: JoMama
Reviews.Content: I bought this months ago and LOVE IT!!!  Super easy to use and upload photos. I haven't really played around with the settings much and have had some trouble getting good shots at weddings (indoors with not much light). I'm sure if i read the instructions I will be able to figure out how to get better pictures indoors. All my other photos have come out great! I love that it's super compact and I really like the brown color (really more burgandy)! Overall i def recommend this camera..esp for anyone that wants something small enough to throw into a little purse or pocket that's easy to use!

Reviews.Title: 8mp perfect point and shoot
Reviews.Author: T. Bldmr
Reviews.Content: 8 mp is plenty for a point and shoot... if i wanna go bigger/faster i gotta save up and get a dslr =) but upon discovering this i think i can hold on to getting a dslr till prices drop even more......this camera is so amazing left me with a smile.... i found out a better way to use this camera to use available light inside the house... yes indoor lighting................ i switched the mode to DIGITAL MACRO !!!for some reason it set up the camera just right without even using flashand took amazing pictures =) i even used zoom in /zoom out-iso was in auto-no flash-antishake is on-fine-M1-autofocus and that icon that looked like a flower w/ the letter "D"-u can zoom to 4xi even took pics of television and the image of tv was captured beautifulidk if this will apply to all point and shoot camera with macro settingbut this particular model i have - powershot elph sd1100is - does the job great.........if i discover some other successful experiment i wont hesitate to share...

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1100IS
Reviews.Author: S. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly because it was a Consumer Reports "Recommended Buy."  I have not been disappointed.  The camera was easy to use right out of the box, but has way more features than I had imagined.  It will take me some time to learn and use them.  I immedaitely took it on a trip to Jamaica and got beautiful pictures.  The controls are very intuitive, especially for those who use cell phones, ipods, etc. and I was able to use many of the features without referring to the manual.  The camera is small and easily fits into a pants or shirt pocket, but, be careful to use the wrist strap as it can easily slip out of your hands.  The view screen is large and bright and easy to see in all lighting conditions.  I highly recommend this camera as it has all the features (and more) of cameras costing much more.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted in a small camera
Reviews.Author: K. Limb
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I wanted a small digital camera for basic everyday pictures and it has been great.  It takes good shots, is easy to take places (it fits in the cell phone pocket of my purse) and is easy to use.The battery life is awesome, I have only had to charge it once in the last three weeks, and I have taken tons of pictures.The only drawback is the memory card that comes with it only holds 13 pictures, so I upgraded it to a 2G one that will hold hundreds.Love this camera!  Have noticed many other people with the same one, and the love it too

Reviews.Title: canon powershot sd1100is
Reviews.Author: dee
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little camera!  Size is perfect, can slide right into my purse.  Takes amazing pictures!  Great price! Pictures show up extremely well on screen, even outside.  Easy to use. Love the gold color. When viewing pics. you can change them from vertical to horizontal just by turning camera. Very cool! I couldn't be happier with purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: D. Vaughns
Reviews.Content: I give all the credit to my wife for finding this camera.  I needed a new camera and she came to my rescue!  All I wanted was something easy to use and compact.  Well, to my surprise I got the PowerShot SD1100IS and it is great!  More pixels than I need, yet a perfect size for travel.  My boss has the SD1000 and he loves his camera...but definitely took interest in mine.  I have a 4GB card, very necessary for a frequent snapshot like myself.  All in all, the size was right and the pictures are great.  Perfect for a high-time traveler like myself.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE CANON
Reviews.Author: Judith Rawstern
Reviews.Content: When I was ready to purchase a new digital camera, I remembered one of my first cameras.  It was a Canon and I loved it.  I did some research and determined Canon is one of the best on the market, so I bought one.

Reviews.Title: Average quality pics in night
Reviews.Author: George M.K
Reviews.Content: Camera is very sleek and handy but when it comes to taking picture in night. It is very grainy. Also based on the megapixel it should have more clarity which it lacks.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for non-photogs
Reviews.Author: Valry Hensel
Reviews.Content: I took more professional-looking photos with this point-and-shoot than my "professional" photographer friends. Realistically if you want a photography career you will want a more robust camera - for everyone else there's this. There are SO many settings, but an extremely use-friendly manual and intuitive user interface on the camera's navigation menu. The color was gorgeous, very metallic but such a pretty, soft periwinkle. I accidentally dropped this and broke the lens, and have replaced it with a "better" Sony...that I'm not hugely fond of. This camera was amazing.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jazzygirl"
Reviews.Content: I bought this 4-5 years ago when I didn't have a cell phone that took very good pictures.  It's a nice size, easy to use, and does take good pictures, but I don't use it much any more because I always have my cell phone with me.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 5 years, now the picture is blurry
Reviews.Author: masj
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera about 5 years and I never really *loved* it - I just never really felt comfortable with it. Anyway, after about 5 years there is something wrong with the focus, about 75% of the pictures are blurry and look off. I am very excited to use this as an excuse to get a new camera! I see it many people love it (which is why I got it in the first place) but it was never the camera for me. Still, a camera should really last longer than 5 years.

Reviews.Title: Still use it, still awesome
Reviews.Author: Kimberly A. Watkins
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of all of the reviews, and the ease of use, by trying my sister's camera of the same model.The SD1100IS 8MP model is the one where they hit the mark on all counts, so even though the 1200 was on its way, I wanted the 1100 specifically.  I still have it after 5 years or so and it is still giving me beautiful photos and movies.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: kit compton
Reviews.Content: This Camera is so good for Kids and adults. It has a lot of settings like color ascent, color change, and all the regular ones. My daughter loves it and I have taken it on Wildland fires for some epic shots.

Reviews.Title: This little guy goes everywhere with me!
Reviews.Author: Sandi Bates
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera!!! I have another one that is worn out. It goes to the snowy mountains, beach, camping, church, my garden...I've taken smashing photos with this indispensable little guy! Even landscapes in Glacier Nt.l park! Wish I could have an attachable long lens but it just does everything-Micro to mountains! Quality surpassing 5 other cameras! The best thing is it's size, it goes in a pocket with my cell phone and Nook, then I'm set to go anywhere. Having the charger and spare battery, and memory chip helps. I really like that you can change to sepia, B&W;, and others. You can do videos, fast motion(kids and pets)portrait, night time and so many other things like F stops, and white balance in different situations.  (I only wish it told me Before the battery was dead.) Buy it before they stop making it! Great lens.

Reviews.Title: not really worth the money
Reviews.Author: FHD MOM
Reviews.Content: not really worth the money.  I bought this for my kids and they didn't really use it (printer). The camera is good

Reviews.Title: Wrong cameranotthe same model as described in the order.
Reviews.Author: Jim W. Metcalf
Reviews.Content: It was not the cotrect model. The seller sent a different camera than what was described. I should have sent it back but needed it for a job right away.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Alexander
Reviews.Content: this is a great camera takes great pictures indoors and out also very durable the sleek design is a plus

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD1100IS
Reviews.Author: R. Kanno "rk4runner"
Reviews.Content: This camera is good. I just used this camera this past Nov. 2013 when I took pictures in Manhatten NYC. I am not the perfect photographer but this camera takes pictures of what I see. Its compact, lite, and easy to use.If a picture comes out blurry or the lighting is wrong, it's not the camera fault, it's my fault. I am not the  person that is critical of every aspect of this camera. If I was then I wouldn't enjoy taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: I Love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Gary S.
Reviews.Content: This is by far my favorite canon Camera & actually a replacement for one which was stolen at a graduation party a few years back. I looked & looked for a replacement bought a different Canon camera which I like but when I came across this camera again I couldn't help but reorder it & couldn't be happier!! Well designed, feature rich canon camera that takes excellent pictures. Wish the zoom was better but still no complaints. Great Product!! Quality is #1.  :-)

Reviews.Title: takes great pics
Reviews.Author: Devorah
Reviews.Content: this little camera takes great photos. easy to use. has advanced features if you want them, but can be just a point and shoot for newbies.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot a fabulous camera
Reviews.Author: K. Warnick
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I've ever owned.  It's not complicated.  I'm not good about protecting my cameras and have been known to drop them occasionally.  This one holds up under my clumsiness.  The pictures are superb

Reviews.Title: Light enough to take with you everywhere.
Reviews.Author: K. Winn
Reviews.Content: This little camera is small enough to bring with you wherever you go--hiking, skiing, bike riding--and takes great pictures and video as well. I use my full size Nikon for night shots and low light level situations, but for most things, this works like a charm. If you travel--this is probably the only camera you'll need unless you're a professional photographer. Sometimes taking photos is just "F4 and be there." With this lightweight camera, you'll always have it with you to capture those moments with kids and grandkids.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Pittle
Reviews.Content: We bought one of these when they first came out and have loved it.  One of the best features is an actual viewfinder, not just the LCD screen, so that you can actually see what you are taking a photo of!  We liked the one we have so much that we bought this one so that we can each have a camera with us.

Reviews.Title: exactly what i wanted and expected
Reviews.Author: Polly Moran
Reviews.Content: I ordered this used camera to replace the same model I had owned and which had been inadvertently dropped in water. I already had batteries, card and charger so only needed to replace a camera which was no longer available to purchase new. This camera works well and has a view screen which is unscratched, unlike my old one. Camera arrived in a timely fashion, was reasonably priced and I am totally satisfied with the product and service. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Still in use
Reviews.Author: Vic Dar
Reviews.Content: Good little camera, still in use after 3 plus years of use.Now it is a backup camera and it never fails when needed

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: bebe
Reviews.Content: Easy to operate and well worth the money.  Originally bought for grandson but kept it for myself and glad I did

Reviews.Title: workhorse!
Reviews.Author: R. Morneau "Ray Morneau"
Reviews.Content: Not outstanding, I suppose.  But, for the price, this model has been a great day in and day out camera for my jobs.

Reviews.Title: Fun to use
Reviews.Author: John W Anderson
Reviews.Content: Great little camera for a good priceEasy to use and fits in yor pocketHas a remarkable zoom, built in flash, and the pictures are good.Carry this little beauty with you at all times and don't miss anythingPriced right

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For The Average Person
Reviews.Author: Joe Andrick
Reviews.Content: I am not a great photographier, but this camera takes great pictures even so.  I have taken this camera on 2 vacations and love every picture taken even the bad ones.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: bj
Reviews.Content: all cameras should be made with  a protective outer layer  :)  It has been dropped a couple of times.  Picture not as sharp.

Reviews.Title: Nice piece of machinery!
Reviews.Author: The man
Reviews.Content: Why am I required to put 20 words??  This is beyond me!  ON a serious note, this is a nice camera.  One advice however, do not buy new unless you can afford it.  Good luck to you my peeps.

Reviews.Title: Camera is Okay
Reviews.Author: Mallik
Reviews.Content: Pictures are not so good quality. The Canon expectation is not seen in this camera. Pictures are blurry in any settings.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: KiwiGirl "Globe Trotter"
Reviews.Content: We have had this camera for year now.  It has gone through alot of family vacations and use and is still operating wonderfully.Canon is such a great manufacturer.  The camera takes pictures quickly and is ready for another shot quickly too....it's flash is funcitonal and the video feature is great for catching things on the go.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: sara
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for over 3 years now and I'm still impressed with it.  It's easy to use and takes a great picture.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because I had to send it to be fixed.  It was within warranty time and came back working fine.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Gould
Reviews.Content: Even though this is an older model Canon PowerShot digital camera, I searched high & low for it.  Reason:  not only does it take great pictures but it has what is missing in newer models -- a view finder which is so helpful in outdoor bright light situations where it is difficult to really see your subject/shot on the digital screen.  It has many other great features which I am still learning and it is small enough to fit in my purse -- which means that I have it with me when those unexpected photo situations come along! I also got this camera at an excellent price with free shipping!  I think I scored all the way around!!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Reiko.N.R.
Reviews.Content: Great buy! I got this camera in Feb.2009. It's been working well for about 4 years. I didn't expect it actually.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever Bought
Reviews.Author: Chico
Reviews.Content: I do not even remember when I purchased this camera, all I know is that I purchased after researching several cameras and I am not disappointed for my decision. I had this camera for a awhile and never had any issues with it. It takes crystal clear pictures automatically, just point and shoot. It is small enough to fit in a pocket. It has an LCD large enough to allow you to see your picture with clarity. Bottom line, I would not buy any other camera.

Reviews.Title: Dont ever buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Smile Savvy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my friend a long while ago and it broke completely within 6months of purchase and never worked again. Quite disappointed and all my money has gone waste.

Reviews.Title: Awwesome Camera
Reviews.Author: MPotter1962
Reviews.Content: This camera was exactly as described and works GREAT!  We love it. It takes awesome pictures and has no physical blemishes.

Reviews.Title: Lost half my vacation pictures
Reviews.Author: Tim the Mick
Reviews.Content: We did a trip to London/Omaha Beach.  Was having a  great time using the camera as it slid in your pocket and was easy to carry around. Unfortunately, in the  middle of our trip, the camera lens fell off its focus track and was useless the rest of the trip.  It was not until after, that I found that this camera has a habit of falling off the track.  Wouldn't purchase another, but this was a small camera that we borrowed and now need to replace. They will now get a new/better version hopefully.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: K. L. Mcclintock
Reviews.Content: I've been using this for a couple years now, and it's been great.  I'm a home inspector, so I need a good camera.  This one has never disappointed me.  The only thing it could use is a self-portrait mode that takes 20 years off...

Reviews.Title: Great Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: gchao
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a Christmas gift and the recipient loves it! The pictures come out with amazing resolution and the camera itself is reliably crafted in a compact body. The main use for the camera was to take pictures during vacations and of parties - essentially capturing memories and its reached beyond expectations. We haven't had the lens error on the camera yet so unsure if the previous reviews regarding lens issues is a manufacturer's defect or if the camera inherently performs this way. It's great for a high resolution pocket camera but if you're looking for something simpler, there are definitely cheaper options.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: The Fresh Prince
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot camera. Extremely simple to use. Shoots high quality videos and even shots night vision for 3-5ft distance. Picture quality is excellent. The picture quality setings the camera comes with make most pictures look great the first time. After owning this camera for a year I went back and bought 3 more so that I do not have to think about it again for many years until they all break from use.

Reviews.Title: lens error
Reviews.Author: Edward I. Williamson
Reviews.Content: apparently Canon has some real issues with this model.  of course it is past it's warranty and I am unable to get past LENS ERROR, RESTART CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power
Reviews.Author: ITC0mputerGuy
Reviews.Content: Canon is just a great product, this was my 3rd camera and ill tell you it does alot, pictures come out great everytime.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Laura Wirsig
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after my old camera died.  I am an amateur when it comes to taking pictures, so I wanted something easy to use.  This camera fit the bill!  I had no trouble figuring out how to use all the various functions.  The pictures were clear and the features perfect for what I was looking for.  The digital zoom works wonderfully.The only issue I have with it is that occasionally the pictures will be grainy, like the focus didn't quite work.  That may be due to my amateur skills, though, and not the fault of the camera.  We've had the camera since 2008, and it has never once broken, or had any problems.

Reviews.Title: great camera, no problems encountered
Reviews.Author: nwshf
Reviews.Content: this is a great camera, no problems encountered at all so far, easy to use and read and understand manual and built in instructionslightweight and fits in a jacket pocketmy photos have all been great thus far and I would buy again

Reviews.Title: My favorite possession
Reviews.Author: Macadoodle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera over 2 years ago and I still LOVE it. The battery life is it's best attribute. But, it is also cute, portable, easy to use, and has great features like stabilizing, picture trimming, red eye correction (automatic and manual). The lighting definitely makes a difference -- It takes the best pictures on bright sunny days or fairly close shots in complete darkness with only the flash. It makes good home videos as well, just make sure your settings are set to your liking.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC!!!
Reviews.Author: amazonshopper
Reviews.Content: This is my second Canon powershot. I love this older model, 8mp, does a fabulous job. Takes fantastic pictures. Highly recommend. Good battery life too.

Reviews.Title: not bad pics and good movies, but not durable
Reviews.Author: Maciej A. Wronski
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from wall mart and from the very beginning I was getting lens error so after 2 weeks I returned it and bought same model online. After 2-3 years of using Im still getting the same error - when turning camera off lenses wont go back and just jam. I need to shake the camera or even use a little force to move them so eventually they return to its neutral position. Now unfortunately camera has totally lost focus and is no use anymore.My mom has gotten exactly same one and same thing has just happened. Its a shame since this is really nice camera for this price but not really durable.

Reviews.Title: Great little Camera
Reviews.Author: JBP
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife as a gift but I also have the exact same camera(in blue of course) and it has been a great camera. I do a lot of motorcycle riding and it has held up well.It has a lot of extra features that come in very handy but I will say I have not taken the time to sit down and learn them all. If your looking for a great little all around point and shoot camera I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Love my camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara Swift
Reviews.Content: This is an exact replacement for a camera I lost.  I wanted another because of the excellent pictures, ease of use and size of the camera.

Reviews.Title: very good camera
Reviews.Author: sarahannegray
Reviews.Content: i received this camera as a gift for Christmas in 2008 and loved it. however in july of 2009 i dropped it in the sand while it was off and the lens was closed and somehow sand got in it and it said lens error and then did not turn on for a month, i would periodically blow on it in hopes to get the sand out, and after a month it just turned on and worked. i would still have this camera if i hadn't dropped it on the open lens this past june, it still turns on and everything, it even takes perfect video but all the pictures have likes and a weird purple tint.... so i believe the camera is great i just need to be a little more careful. :)

Reviews.Title: I hope I don't get the lens error...again.
Reviews.Author: ml111
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on March 2008 and used it intensively for two years until this spring I got the lens error. It could have been my fault because I was using at a beach and some sand could have gotten in the lens mechanism(I was careful to avoid that). The feature I loved about this camera is the macro mode. I enjoyed taking pictures of small animals and insects and this camera rendered superb images with amazing detail. It did a much better job than my Nikon D80 and the crispness and detail was amazing. So, after months of reading reviews and testing friends and families cameras(sony, nikon, olympus, new canons, etc), there was not one that could match this cameras image quality and I decided to buy it again. Yes, it may sound stupid but I want the best image possible, if the newer cameras are not up to the job I will not buy them, and a quality macro lens for the Nikon is too expensive.I just hope I do not get the lens error soon.

Reviews.Title: My wife loves this camera
Reviews.Author: J. Lee
Reviews.Content: My wife loves this camera.  She wanted a camera to take pictures of the kids without taking out our bulkier 35mm DSLR.  It has a video function with sound which captures those moments that come and goes in a flash.

Reviews.Title: Love my camera
Reviews.Author: Olusola
Reviews.Content: I've had this for 18 months now and I love it. The picture quality is superb and transferring with the USB cable is easy. I even use it to take self-timed portraits for my blog. I recommend this as a good first digital camera for an amateur photographer

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: lizard
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift for Christmas in 2008 and I have been using it constantly for the last year and a half. The camera is great, I have no problems with it AT ALL. My only complaint is that the pictures do kinda suck when you're in a very low-light situation and too far away from your subject to use the flash (i.e. at a wedding and not up front). The pictures come out grainy and blurry because without the flash, it won't focus on anything in particular. Other than that, I've had no problems, and even the videos come out great! No error messages yet so hopefully it continues!

Reviews.Title: Get the Picture/Picture Perfect
Reviews.Author: BeatleBangs1964
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent as well as attractive and compact digital camera.  You get clear, crisp images and it is very user friendly.  It is also ideal for travel as it is extremely light and you will be glad to have it if you want to catch and preserve a moment.Although it is made of anondized aluminum, it is extremely light and yet quite durable.  It has an 8MP CCD sensor.  The instruction booklet makes a good thing even better still as it is written with directions as clear and sharp as the images you will get when you use this camera.With this camera you can also record; use for movies and its nonpareil metering system can "catch" and freeze images that are largely in shadows or possibly over-exposed to light.  The zoom feature is allows for good, clear close up images.The only drawback I experienced, albeit minor was that the shutter speed of 1/1500 second is still not quick enough to freeze some action shots.That having been said, this is an excellent camera that will serve its users well.  Be sure to stock up on some spare batteries just in case you need to replace them.  Instead of using the 32MB memory card which comes with the camera, use a pair of 4GB SDHC memory cards instead.  They will come in handy if you want to shoot movies with your Canon.This is an excellent camera that amateurs to pros use and it is a worthwhile investment.  Canon stands behind its products and rightfully so.  You can count on enjoying high caliber photographs and the lightness and durability of this model will ensure that it gets plenty of use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Ava
Reviews.Content: This is a great easy to use camera with high quality pictures. Simple. Definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome, Cheap Camera
Reviews.Author: CD
Reviews.Content: Tough to find a better camera for the price.  Great picture quality, extremely easy to use.  Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD1100IS
Reviews.Author: Edwin R. Schertzer Jr.
Reviews.Content: A great product that is easy to use and highly portable. It works flawlessly and it is very simple to use by anyone. Excellent image quality. I longer telephoto capability would be nice. I got it in pink for my wife and so that it is easy to identify.

Reviews.Title: Nice quality camera
Reviews.Author: Simmer "itsme0209"
Reviews.Content: I bought the light blue camera for a friend for their birthday and they loved it.The quality of the images comes out very clean. The size over the camera overall is pretty small. Especially in comparison to my Casio Exilim which is very picky with the slightest bit of motion. I must admit, I am a little jealous.The build quality of this camera feels very solid and sturdy.Kodaks always felt very cheap to me, and Sony's always have the WORST file menu systems! Not to mention their proprietary memory cards.Olympus and Fuji are also very good choices but if you want the best, go for a Canon.Canon makes the best quality cameras in my opinion, with Nikon following behind.I would recommend this digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Great portable Camera
Reviews.Author: Lara
Reviews.Content: While I love the quality of pictures from my SLR its just too big to carry around easily.  The Canon PowerShot fits easily in my pocket (even in the separate case I purchased) and is great for fast photos, especially with on-the-go kids.  The ability to take multiple pictures in a row is still not great with these little point and shoots so I'll defer to my expensive SLR for catching those blow out the candle shots at birthday parties (we had a previous Canon PowerShot/Elphy for about 4 years before it died and it was more expensive to fix than to replace).  Overall the PowerShot SD1100IS is a solid camera that is easy to use (so easy we purchased one for our 9 year old and he loves it).

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUY
Reviews.Author: YVETTE "MOE JOE MOM"
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT,THE SPECIAL FEATURES ARE WHAT MADE ME DECIDE ON THIS MODEL AND I WAS NOT DISAPOINTED THE MORE I USE IT THE MORE I LOVE IT.  MEMORY STICK WAS KIND OF SMALL SO I PURCHASE A MUCH LARGER ONE AND EXTRA BATTERY FOR VACATIONS.  THE SLIDER BUTTON FOR CHOOSING CAMERA,VIDE,PLAY IS KIND OF CHEAP BUT. I LOVE THE FEATURES.

Reviews.Title: Faster than any other camera I've played with
Reviews.Author: B. Reid
Reviews.Content: Lots of reviews out there, but few mention how snappy this camera is. Nearly instant start-up, which I consider a requirement so that you don't miss that special photo b/c you are twiddling your thumbs waiting for the camera to boot. Similarly, the camera responds very quickly when taking a photo. Again a requirement for me.I have been thoroughly impressed by image quality.I was recently disappointed when I dropped the camera onto a hard floor and the lens cell became inoperable..."lens error" or something similar...my favorite camera is not useless...but then again, maybe I shouldn't have dropped it onto concrete...

Reviews.Title: Super Great camera.
Reviews.Author: oldepossum
Reviews.Content: Great camera I have one and bought a 2nd for my folks, as the film cameras are getting harder to find and have the film developed. The movie mode is good if you can't get the right still shot, the voice recorder is wonderful for getting the whole story during a family story time. Paired with the Micca Slimm[...] Mom and Dad don't even have to have a computer to see their pictures, listen to their voice recordings or watch their just shot movie on their HD TV. The auto mode on the camera does just about everything for them to get a great shot.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!!
Reviews.Author: MackieBu
Reviews.Content: I love it! The color is starting to chip but that's okay. I always use it and I take it with me whenever I don't feel like using my DSLR. It's compact, perfect for when you're clubbing or during parties etc.Easy to use and less complicated than DSLR ( of course!)It's well worth the money.;)

Reviews.Title: Good point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: J. Cohn
Reviews.Content: This camera is similar the model before with some advanced features, such as functionality to select portrait or certain scenery options. The only factor I am slightly disappointed with is the ability to take night-shots. The pictures often come up blurry or completely dark. There is a night setting which helps slightly but not perfectly. The zoom is quite good and picture quality exceeded my expectation. The battery lasts well over 400 pictures. It is light-weight and easy to travel with, just got back from Hawaii and am quite pleased with all my scenery pictures. Would recommend this camera for every day needs, would look for a different camera if intending to take a lot of pictures at night.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.. great quality pictures and video... at very good price
Reviews.Author: Prakash
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera almost a year back from Amazon.  I have really enjoyed and very satisfied with this camera. Great picture quality, great video at very good price.  It is very small in size and fits in hand or small pockets.  Very easy to carry around. I was hesitant to buy this blue color camera, but it looked great when I saw it in a store before ordering on amazon.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot goes beyond a point & shoot
Reviews.Author: Llamaguy "World traveler"
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot SD1100IS 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom is a great step beyond a basic point and shoot digital camera. The options to override the Auto function are almost unlimited. By using Manual mode you can set and store special focus and exposure settings. I take a lot of landscape pictures so have set one of the available stored manual settings to compensate for outdoor bright light and blue/green color balance. Many of the the same functions, such as color balance for interior lighting, are also available on Auto. The combo of digital zoom to supplement the optical one gives very good resolution and the image statilization DOES WORK very well. The small camera size means it can easily be carried in a shirt pocket or small purse so you'll have it with you. You can control the image size (resolution) and the larger MB files can be enlarged to 16"x20" w/o loss of quality. You can adjust ISO (or leave Auto). This camera's only shortcoming is that it does NOT allow you to set an f-stop or a shutter speed and still have an auto mode.

Reviews.Title: O.K.
Reviews.Author: Melanie Gonsecki
Reviews.Content: Digital camera are not going to be very good unless you pay hundred of dollars. I have had mine for less than a year and am ready to trade it in. The picture quality is not perfect. The settings never seem to go with the room. After editing the pictures on Piacaso they turn out quite well. Not the most durable and mine has been through a lot. Good ,but slightly overpriced. Honestly there someone tell me if there is a camera better than this one, they all suck!

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Carvalho
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Cannon digital camera and what I can say is: It rocks!Very good product! It takes and films with a very nice quality, it is small, the batery doesn't run out quickly even if you are using it as recorder.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: V. Crawford
Reviews.Content: What a camera!  I did a LOT of research before buying this camera for my wife and I, and I have been VERY, VERY pleased with the photos we get with it.  I've taken several photos people can't believe came from a pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: Good things come in small packages
Reviews.Author: D. Ott "pic lady"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace the one I gave to my mom. That one I had initially gotten because of a great deal I got on it. Since then I have used it more than my "big" camera. It is the nicest little thing I have gotten and man does it take pictures. The pictures are amazing and it is very very versatile. It is also easy to use and just very handy to have around. Put it in a nice carry case and it can go anywhere with you, mine is always in my purse, ready to go at a moments notice. Now my mom and 2 co-workers have the very same camera. Definitly a great buy.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Loretta EE
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for my aunt.  She loves it.  I did it because my son bought one and he recommended it.  I recommended it to him after reading all the info on it I could find.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera
Reviews.Author: H. Qureshi
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best camera I have ever owned.  I have had it for over a year now and it operates as if it were brand new. I will always buy canon's from now on. The pictures on this camera are great.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD1200 10MP
Reviews.Author: Cookie Gerhart
Reviews.Content: Purchased to replace a stolen Canon, different model.  Construction is light so it seems flimsy but the pictures look great, it's pretty easy to use, and can't beat the size for portability.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Viscardi
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my Canon SD1100 IS.  I had it for over a year and I hardly ever had any issues with it.  I definitely got a great camera for the price when I purchased it. I had previously owned a Panasonic camera I had purchased for approximately $200 and it didn't have anywhere near the features that the SD1100 did. The Panasonic didn't even have an optical zoom. My only issue with the SD1100 is the poor picture quality in low-light settings without a flash, but, then again, it's not a professional quality camera. Unfortunately, it was stolen this weekend while I was out on the town with some friends and in looking to replace it, I was flabbergasted that it is selling for almost $400. I bought it for $160 last year! I'm going to upgrade to the SD1200 IS and I'm hoping that it delivers on par with the SD1100.

Reviews.Title: Amaing Camera!
Reviews.Author: Susan Palmeri
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a long time and have loved it all the way through.here is my list of pros and cons:Pros,SmallLightweightgreat image quality and scenesgood quality zoomhas a viewfindertakes sd cardstakes timelapse video(ultra fast forward)Cons,not the coolest looking camerathe screen is smaller than normalweak flash(for faraway shots)zoom during video can get grainy.My conclusion.In the end i find this camera doing everything in a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Super camera!
Reviews.Author: Sparkle Pony
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures, is easy to use and haven't had any problems with it.[...]

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted
Reviews.Author: Jake "BSGwon'tplay:("
Reviews.Content: A great little camera.  Have used it in a number of settings, and a number of conditions, and it works very well for everything I could want.I've found that by upping the granularity to superfine, and by increasing the color spectrum to vivid, I'm able to get extremely useful shots.  This drops the amount of pictures I can have from around 4000 to about 1300.I would recommend this to anyone who's looking for a simple camera for everyday use.  It has some advanced features which are really cool, but the overall ease of use with this item is the reason I bought it.Worth noting - the camera appears to be very durable, as it's survived two falls and one rainstorm (covered).  :)Haven't been disappointed yet!

Reviews.Title: Good and light weight
Reviews.Author: Kevin "Kevin"
Reviews.Content: Meets the usual expectations of canon. The weight is great and nice that I can use all the old accesories from my previous canon which broke...

Reviews.Title: GREAT POCKET CAMERA GIVES BIG RESULTS
Reviews.Author: Steve Cohan
Reviews.Content: This is my second Canon SD camera. I buy them mainly for their size because I take them with me on horseback. I am also a professional photographer. If you know minimums about photography, this unit will deliver better than satisfactory results. For the most part, the AUTO mode will produce nice images. Just follow the rule of not shooting direcly into the sun. If you buy the unit, don't forget to enable the IMAGE STABILIZER function. I have never shot a blurry image. If you want to venture into some customized settings, you will need to switch the unit to the manual mode. Most of the settings in the auto mode cannot be changed. I use a fill in flash a lot in outdoor photography. When in the manual mode, you can choose flash auto, flash always on, flash always off. I also use the manual mode to set the ISO to 80. Last night I went to an indoor entertainment event in a nearly dark venue. My first few shots were pretty dark. I went into the manual mode and raised the EV to +2 and got some great shots. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Very quick, great service
Reviews.Author: WP News "Rhonda"
Reviews.Content: Everything went great with my order and I am very satisfied. Great camera!They don't sell this item in stores anymore. What a shame!

Reviews.Title: Excellent versatile pocket sized camera
Reviews.Author: Stanley O. Chang "stan1911"
Reviews.Content: I bought this brown colored compact pocket sized camera to replace an older S300.  I delighted in the compact size.  It is truly a pocket sized gem.  I used it extensively for quick shots.  Extremely convenient but still capable of decent photos and good resolution.  The image stabilization feature adds so much usefullness in a light small camera that for most email shots, I grab my SD1100 instead of my Nikon D3.  Macro shots at max resolution can be cropped to yield very good images.  I left it in the console of my car one day and also left the garage door up 6" or so to vent heat - and forgot to close it at night.  The next morning, I found a thief (prob a young person) had crawled under the door and ransacked my car, stole my SD1100 and an iphone FM transmitter.  I ordered a replacement SD1200 from Amazon.  I'll just have to live with Grey color instead of the Brown I have grown so fond of.I shot a video of an intense hailstorm and noticed that the zoom in movie mode degrades the image to the point of uselessness.  The sound recording is very good for a camera smaller than a pack of cards.  I would have bought another SD1100 but they are $100 more than the SD1200, so I ordered the SD1200.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding results from a point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: Pratap Sampat
Reviews.Content: We got better-than-expected results from this camera. All daytime shots could be enlarged up to 18" X 12" size without loss of crispness.

Reviews.Title: Like It
Reviews.Author: tiger iris lady
Reviews.Content: I like this camera. Nice to have a view finder. Lots of options. Good quality photos. Zoom is good for such a small camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Keely
Reviews.Content: I got this camera just last Christmas and I am in love with it!!! It is a wonderful camera, not to mention a beautiful color!!! :) It is easy to operate. The pictures come out beautifully. The zoom is just enough to get a good far-away picture. It is small and easy to carry around. It has great features. I could go on and on!!! This probably isn't for a proffesional photographer, but for someone like me who just loves to go around and take pictures, this is a WONDERFUL camera!!!!! I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Point-and-Shoot - Unbelievable Battery Life
Reviews.Author: Princepessa
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last November, and I love it! I chose it because Canon has one of the best digital camera reputations. I also chose it because it has a viewfinder, a rarity in today's digital camera world. Almost no digital point-and-shoot cameras have viewfinders, at least those under $200 (I bought this for $160). The screen stopped working completely on my previous camera, rendering it useless. A viewfinder would have allowed me to continue to use it without a hitch. It has very good stabilization and it feels well-made. The battery life in this camera is AMAZING! Granted, I don't use it that often, but I've taken over 200 pictures with it without the battery bar going down at all. I've only charged it 2 or 3 times in the 8 months I've had it. However, the battery bar is not a good indicator towards the end of the charge - once it goes down to one, you need to plug it in right away! The charger is also small and not cumbersome - you just place the battery in the charger and plug it into the wall - there isn't a cord! I have not had a single problem with this camera. Yes, I have had the battery/SD card slot door pop open, but neither the battery or the card have fallen out because the battery has a little lever that holds it in place and the SD card has to be pushed in in order to pop out. I put a screen protector over the screen and so far, it doesn't have any scratches. The outside of the camera looks brand-new. I love this camera and I would recommend it to anyone. I am not a photographer, nor do I have any experience with photos other for making digital photo books, but my pictures I've taken with this camera have satisfied me. If you want a newer camera, I'd look at any camera following in this camera's footsteps.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Yamuna
Reviews.Content: Excellent Camera, very pleased. I couldn't comment on the specifications etc. from a professional point of view but I should say it has amazing clarity even on zoom and a quick shutter speed which made it easier for me to snap up excellent pictures of fast disappearing objects like fireworks. Hardly went wrong!The lens error message I read about did come a couple of times, esp when some water was sprinkling around in a water park- I just turned the camera off immediately and checked the camera front to see if the lens were properly closed and prayed. It worked fine when I switched it on a few minutes later, both the times. :)The camera is slim, fits into the jeans pocket without a problem- there are slimmer cameras out there but I am not sure if they are as sturdy as this one. The blue colour is very pleasant and great price (150$ ish)

Reviews.Title: Beautifully designed, fatastic lens
Reviews.Author: Ethan Winning "Ethan Winning"
Reviews.Content: I currently own one 9 year old Olympus 3.75 MB digital camera (with an iffy macro), a Canon A620, but am now back to just the Canon S3 IS as my daily digital. However, I had a good experience with the S5 IS and so, when it came time to buy my wife her first camera (for her birthday) - even with 20 years' experience with Olympus SLRs and Zuiko lenses - I chose the Canon PowerShot SD1100IS 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Gold), what I'm still calling an Elph. It's just easier.In showing her how to use it (the manual is twice the size of the one that came with my last computer), I fell in love with this little gem. It feels good. The LCD is big enough, but more important, the viewfinder is spot on. (It is not adjustable as is the S3 IS, but my wife doesn't need glasses.) 8MP is sufficient for casual photographers unless you're planning on printing billboard-size photos ... but then you wouldn't be a casual photographer.My wife wanted a camera to take picture of the grandkids and other family members (not that "other family members" become a secondary category once grandchildren arrive even though they do), but after taking a few picture of the dog, we went to San Francisco's Botanical Gardens. She took more than 200 pictures (ah, the difference between digital film) and, with no experience, came out with more than 40 fantastic shots including some macros that will certainly go into an album that she's now planning.I took another 100 photos around the local park and have posted them on my own "amateur" site where you can compare the four digital cameras I've now used for nature photography.The only feature that I would change IF it could be changed is to make the optical zoom 20x which, of course, is laughable in a tiny package such as this. The other features from macro to image stabilization are fantastic.There are many features which I'm sure my wife will never use, and there are some features the importance or value of which I've yet to figure out. Face detection is one, the print-share button (which gets you to buy a Canon printer, but also enables emailing photos), and to be honest, the LCD. Yes, when I got my Olympus in 2000, I loved the LCD. But within a month I found that, no matter how you set the display, about half the time you can't see the LCD clearly because of sunlight. But that's me. Most people I see using digital cameras use the LCD.All and all, this is just a great little camera with huge capabilities. If I wasn't afraid of missing a shot of a bird on my walks, I'd take my wife's camera instead of my S3.As I've said in all of my reviews of cameras, if you cannot focus, this camera will do that for you. If you cannot center a photo and come out with pictures of people without heads or other appendages, no camera will do that for you. Perhaps some people are born with composition and technique in their blood, and other just have a composition disability. If you fall into the latter category, read other reviews: maybe somebody has found the solution.Oh, and by the way, the gold SD1100IS takes much better pictures than the blue even though the blue is at times more expensive. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the camera.  It takes great photos, fits in my pocket, and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great little package
Reviews.Author: G. Chung
Reviews.Content: This is a great little performer.  Very small.  Easily fits into pockets.  Image stabilization is great.  Recording video is very smooth.  Battery life is very good and it's very easy to get in and out of the camera.  I like the color accent feature although I've rarely used it.  Scrathes easily, though.  And flash doesn't work as good as I hoped in very dark settings.  Notes...For some reason, the blue camera is about 20% cheaper than the other colors.  Get at least a 4Gb SD card for it; especially if you plan on recording video.  I found several for only $10 at Amazon.  The software that comes with it isn't very good; especially if you're trying to transfer video -- I keep getting errors.  I now just use Windows Explorer to drag the files into my destination folder.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product and Service
Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: I ordered a refurbished Cannon SD1100 on June 8 and received it in a Cannon box, just like new in less than one week.  It came with all the instruction books, battery, recharger, and other items just as though purchased new.  Great product, and it was delivered on time and in perfect condition.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: R. Lighthall "jl-rl"
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera a few weeks but I love it!  It takes great pictures, even in the dark.  The camera I had before was a Canon also.  I will always buy Canon.

Reviews.Title: Lovin' my Canon
Reviews.Author: Uomo Americano
